availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry C. Banks (New York County, New York, attorney and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: New York County, New York, attorney and commissioner of deeds. Kentucky native. Married to Mary T. Banks. Father of Shepherd Banks, Blanche Banks, and Florence Banks. Attorney in New York County in 1855. Employed Ann Locklin and Mary Mahoney as servants in New York City in 1855. Commissioner of deeds and notary public in New York City in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Census of the State of New York (1855), New York County, City New York, Ward 18, District 1, p. 30.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, New York, New York County, New York City, Ward 18, District 4, p. 162B.
Episcopal Diocese of New York Church Records, 1767-1970, The Episcopal Diocese of New York, New York City, New York, 1888-1897. p. 482.
KYR-0001-031-0095.
